data.title: Skyhawks offering dollar beers at every Tuesday night game
data.meta_description: Team slashes prices on all concessions Augusta - Ben Wittkowski, General Manager of the Sussex Skyhawks, announced today that the team will offer 12-o...
data.text: Team slashes prices on all concessions Augusta - Ben Wittkowski, General Manager of the Sussex Skyhawks, announced today that the team will offer 12-ounce beers and 16-ounce sodas for one dollar during all Tuesday night home games for the rest of the season. âOur concessions menu has been a tremendous success,â said Wittkowski. âFans have been raving about both the variety, quality and lower prices that our new menu provides. This expanded menu is just one of the many ways the Skyhawks are providing competitive baseball in a family-friendly environment for all of Sussex County to enjoy.â In an effort to make Skylands Park more family-friendly, the Skyhawks are implementing an expanded concessions menu utilizing new food preparation facilities installed by the organization during the offseason. In addition to fan-favorites like hot dogs and hamburgers, the team will now offer many specialty items such as Buffalo wings, popcorn chicken nuggets and fried shrimp. While offering this expanded new menu, the team has lowered the prices of all concessions; hot dogs that cost $3.50 at Skylands Park last year now cost $2. On July 23, in honor of the classic car show held at Skylands Park that day, the Skyhawks will be offering 50-cent hot dogs throughout the game. For more information regarding the car show and other exciting promotions happening at Skylands Park this summer, log on to: www.sussexskyhawks.com . As promised, the Skyhawks have cut prices across the board. Individual game tickets are now $10 for box seats, $8 for reserved seats and $6 for general admission bleachers. Parking fees will now be $3 per automobile. Single-game tickets for all games during the 2006 season are on sale now, including the launch of the teamâs new online ticket availability on the teamâs Web site, www.sussexskyhawks.com . In addition to using the teamâs Web site, tickets can be obtained in many different ways. The box office at Skylands Park is open from 10 a.m. - 6 p.m., Monday to Friday and 10 a.m. - 1 p.m. on Saturdays. Tickets can also be purchased via phone at 973-300-1000 or via hard mail by printing out an order form and mailing it in. In all cases, the consumer will have the option of having the tickets mailed to an address or held at the will call booth on the day of the game. The Skyhawks are also offering many different group discount packages. Season tickets are available for $380 for box seats and $300 for reserved seats. Also available are 6, 12 and 25 game mini-plans, picnic and birthday packages. Please visit www.sussexskyhawks.com for more information. As part of the independent Can-Am league, the Skyhawks will host 46 exciting games against the Brockton Rox, Nashua Pride, New Haven Cutters, New Jersey Jackals, North Shore Spirit, Les Capitales de Quebec, and the Worcester Tornadoes. Standard game times are 7:05 pm Monday through Friday, 5:05 p.m. on Saturdays and 2:05 p.m. on Sundays.
